dt: {bc}{d_link|inference|inference} formed without proof or sufficient evidence

dt.t: The criminal's motive remains a matter of {wi}conjecture{/wi}.

dt: {bc}a proposition (as in mathematics) before it has been proved or disproved

quotes.t: Peculiar features of early maps, which may have been nothing but a draftsman's whimsy, have inspired pages of vain {qword}conjecture{/qword}.
The reason why the French with superior man-power and American resources were doing so poorly was not beyond all {qword}conjecture{/qword}.
Whether Columbus brought syphilis to the New World—or to the Old World—has been the subject of {qword}conjecture{/qword} for at least 500 years.
… their voices rose in a chorus of {qword}conjecture{/qword} and alarm, repeating the selfsame remark: "What is she going to do? I mean, is Betty going to faint?"

et: Middle English, from Middle French or Latin; Middle French, from Latin {it}conjectura{/it}, from {it}conjectus{/it}, past participle of {it}conicere{/it}, literally, to throw together, from {it}com-{/it} + {it}jacere{/it} to throw {ma}{mat|jet|}{/ma}
shortdef: inference formed without proof or sufficient evidence
a conclusion deduced by surmise or guesswork
a proposition (as in mathematics) before it has been proved or disproved

dt: {bc}to arrive at or deduce by {d_link|surmise|surmise:1} or guesswork {bc}{sx|guess||}

dt.t: scientists {it}conjecturing{/it} that a disease is caused by a defective gene

quotes.t: I am anxious to {qword}conjecture{/qword} beforehand what may be expected from the sowing turneps [sic] in jaded ground, how much from the acre, & how large they will be?
… their traces left for future archaeologists to rediscover and perhaps to wonder or {qword}conjecture{/qword} over.
It is fashionable now to {qword}conjecture{/qword} that the Big Bang was caused by a random quantum fluctuation in a vacuum devoid of space and time.

shortdef: to arrive at or deduce by surmise or guesswork : guess

dt: used to say that something is based on an idea formed without proof or sufficient evidence

dt.t: Her plans for the election are still {it}a matter of conjecture{/it}.

shortdef: —used to say that something is based on an idea formed without proof or sufficient evidence
